importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: This is the date of the news article update, indicating when the investigation into Kada Scott’s disappearance reached a significant milestone with the discovery of human remains and the arrest of suspect Keon King.
This is the date Kada Scott was last seen at her workplace, marking the beginning of the timeline for her disappearance and the start of police investigations into her whereabouts.
The day after Scott’s disappearance, investigators began tracking phone communications leading to the arrest of Keon King, who was identified as the last known contact with her.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The two-week period between Scott’s disappearance and the discovery of human remains in a shallow grave highlights the urgency and duration of the investigation, showing that despite extensive efforts, the case remained unresolved until the remains were found.

keyTakeAways: Human remains of an unidentified female were found in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia, two weeks after Kada Scott vanished.
A man named Keon King, 21, was arrested and charged with the kidnapping of Kada Scott, as well as a prior kidnapping case involving a woman he allegedly assaulted.
Police believe King was the last person in contact with Scott, as tracking of his phone communications led investigators to him.
The case is part of a suspected 'pattern' of behavior, with King previously charged in a domestic kidnapping case that charges were refiled after a witness failed to appear.
A public tip led police to a gold 1999 Toyota Camry, believed to be linked to King, which was found in an apartment complex parking lot and is now under investigation.
Scott’s family has repeatedly urged the public to come forward with any information, emphasizing that small details could be vital to solving the case.
The remains have been taken to the medical examiner’s office for identification, with the possibility that they belong to Kada Scott still under evaluation.
The investigation is being led by the Philadelphia Police Department’s homicide division with support from the FBI’s Violent Crime Task Force.
Video and digital evidence show Scott was in contact with King shortly after leaving her workplace, and she disconnected from all communications after that point.

namedEntities.name: Kada Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 23-year-old woman from Philadelphia who went missing on October 4, 2025, and whose body was later found in a shallow grave.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Kada Scott is the central figure in the missing persons case, whose disappearance prompted a major investigation and whose remains were found in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school.

namedEntities.name: Keon King
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 21-year-old suspect arrested and charged with the kidnapping of Kada Scott and a prior kidnapping case involving a woman he allegedly assaulted.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Keon King is the primary suspect in Scott’s disappearance, identified through phone tracking and linked to prior criminal activity, suggesting a pattern of behavior.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Police First Deputy Commissioner John Stanford
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A law enforcement official who provided updates on the investigation and confirmed that the remains are under medical examiner’s care.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Stanford is a key authority in the case, providing official statements about the discovery of remains and the ongoing investigation.

namedEntities.name: Assistant District Attorney Ashley Toczylowski
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A prosecutor who led the district attorney’s office in the investigation and provided updates on the suspect and phone tracking.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Toczylowski played a key role in confirming that Keon King was the last person in contact with Scott and in explaining the prior kidnapping case.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Mayor Cherelle Parker
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The city’s chief official who issued a public statement supporting Kada Scott’s family.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Parker’s statement shows the city’s public support for the family and underscores the emotional and societal impact of the case.

namedEntities.name: Kevin Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Kada Scott’s father, who has been urging the public to come forward with information.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Kevin Scott is a key family member expressing the family’s anguish and emphasizing the public’s potential role in solving the case.

namedEntities.name: Kim Matthews
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Kada Scott’s mother, who expressed fear and desperation over her daughter’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Kim Matthews represents the emotional core of the case and highlights the family’s plea for answers and safety.

namedEntities.name: FBI Violent Crime Task Force
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A federal law enforcement unit assisting the Philadelphia Police Department in the investigation.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The FBI’s involvement adds federal-level scrutiny and resources to the investigation, indicating the severity of the case.

namedEntities.name: gold 1999 Toyota Camry
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A vehicle believed to be linked to Keon King and possibly used in the disappearance of Kada Scott.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The vehicle is a key piece of physical evidence, and its discovery via a public tip marks a significant breakthrough in the investigation.

namedEntities.name: abandoned school
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A location where the remains of Kada Scott were found in a shallow grave behind it.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The abandoned school is the geographic site of the discovery, indicating a specific and potentially hidden location tied to the crime.

namedEntities.name: medical examiner’s office
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The agency responsible for determining whether the remains belong to Kada Scott.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The medical examiner is essential to the case’s closure, as it determines if the remains are those of Kada Scott.

namedEntities.name: public tip
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An anonymous report that led investigators to the shallow grave and later to the Toyota Camry.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The tip is pivotal, showing that community involvement is critical and that small pieces of information can lead to major breakthroughs.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A 23-year-old Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, went missing on October 4, 2025, after disconnecting from her phone and social media at her workplace. Two weeks later, human remains of an unidentified female were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school, prompting police to investigate. Authorities identified Keon King, a 21-year-old man, as the suspect based on phone tracking and his prior criminal history involving a domestic kidnapping. King is charged with Scott’s kidnapping and with a previous case where he allegedly assaulted and kidnapped a woman. A public tip led investigators to a gold 1999 Toyota Camry believed to be connected to King, which was later found in a parking lot. The case is being investigated by the Philadelphia Police Department’s homicide division with assistance from the FBI’s Violent Crime Task Force. The remains are now under examination by the medical examiner to determine if they belong to Kada Scott. The family has expressed deep anguish and is urging the public to come forward with any information. Officials emphasize that this case may represent a pattern of behavior by King, and that every piece of information—no matter how small—could be crucial to solving it.
title: Police Investigate Disappearance of Philadelphia Woman; Human Remains Found in Shallow Grave Behind Abandoned School
